{"step_by_step_thinking": "The World Health Organization (WHO) defines a high endemic area for meningococcal meningitis as a region where the disease is constantly present at a high incidence rate. The incidence rate is the number of new cases per population at risk in a given time period. According to WHO, a high endemic area for meningococcal meningitis is considered when the incidence rate is greater than 10 per 100,000 population.", "answer_choice": "C"}
